title: How to Make Tropical Parfaits

steps.headline: Combine the Greek-style yogurt, honey, and vanilla extract.
steps.description: Measure these ingredients out and place them into a medium-sized bowl. Use a whisk or spoon to mix them together until well-incorporated.

steps.headline: Slice the fruit.
steps.description: Rinse the strawberries and slice them into ½ inch pieces. Slice the papaya lengthwise, then scoop out the seeds. Cut the flesh of the fruit away from the skin, then cut into ½ inch pieces. Slice the leaves and base off the pineapple, then cut the peel off. Slice the fruit away from the core and dice into ½ inch pieces. If fresh pineapple and papaya isn’t available, use the canned variety. For the healthiest option, looked for canned fruit packed in its own juice (rather than syrup).

steps.headline: Layer the ingredients into six glasses.
steps.description: Set out your glasses and layer the elements in the following order: papaya chunks, yogurt mixture, pineapple chunks, yogurt mixture, strawberry slices, yogurt mixture. Top each glass off with one tablespoon of low-fat granola. Serve immediately. Experiment with other toppings like dried coconut flakes, macadamia nuts, fresh lemon zest and sliced almonds.

methods.name: Putting Together Easy Tropical Breakfast Parfaits

steps.headline: Put two tablespoons of yogurt into each glass.
steps.description: Set out four juice glasses and spoon two tablespoons of vanilla yogurt into the bottom of each one. Use low-fat or non-fat yogurt – whichever you prefer. Feel free to experiment with other yogurt flavors. Strawberry and coconut yogurt would both be excellent tropical-themed yogurt alternatives.

steps.headline: Divide the mandarin orange slices between the four glasses.
steps.description: Open the canned mandarin slices and drain away the juice/syrup. Evenly divide the slices between the four glasses and layer them on top of the yogurt.

steps.headline: Add a layer of cereal followed by more yogurt.
steps.description: Measure out 1 ½ tablespoons of the breakfast cereal and sprinkle it on top of the oranges in each glass. Spoon two more tablespoons of yogurt over the cereal layer. This recipe calls crisped rice cereal, but you can experiment with your favorite cereals and granola.

steps.headline: Add a layer of diced pineapple.
steps.description: Cut the base off the pineapple, then cut away the peel. Slice the pineapple away from the core and dice them into bite-sized chunks. Layer ¼ cup of pineapple into each glass. If fresh pineapple isn’t available, use canned pineapple packed in its own juice.

steps.headline: Add a final layer of cereal.
steps.description: Top it all off with 1 ½ tablespoons of breakfast cereal. Serve immediately. Try additional toppings like dried coconut flakes, macadamia nuts, sliced almonds and dried cranberries.

methods.name: Making Low-Carb Tropical Berry and Almond Breakfast Parfaits

steps.headline: Combine the cream, sugar substitute and extract.
steps.description: Measure out these ingredients and place them in a medium-sized bowl. Beat the ingredients with a mixer on medium speed until stiff peaks form.

steps.headline: Fold the yogurt into the mixture.
steps.description: Measure out the Greek yogurt and place it into the bowl with the cream mixture. Run a rubber spatula or large metal spoon around the sides of the bowl, then along the base, in one smooth motion. Fold the mixture over itself. Rotate the bowl 90 degrees and repeat. Stop once the ingredients are incorporated.

steps.headline: Puree the raspberries and sugar substitute.
steps.description: Rinse one cup of raspberries and place them into a blender. Add the remaining sugar substitute on top and put the lid on. Pulse the blender until the mixture appears smooth.

steps.headline: Layer the ingredients in the glasses.
steps.description: Set out four parfait glasses and alternate the ingredients in each glass in this order: whipped cream, raspberry puree, blueberries, nuts, and coconut. Make two layers of each per glass. Serve immediately. Consider additional toppings like macadamia nuts, sliced almonds, low-fat granola and dried cranberries.

text: Making Tropical Fruit Parfaits Combine the Greek-style yogurt, honey, and vanilla extract. Measure these ingredients out and place them into a medium-sized bowl. Use a whisk or spoon to mix them together until well-incorporated. Slice the fruit. Rinse the strawberries and slice them into ½ inch pieces. Slice the papaya lengthwise, then scoop out the seeds. Cut the flesh of the fruit away from the skin, then cut into ½ inch pieces. Slice the leaves and base off the pineapple, then cut the peel off. Slice the fruit away from the core and dice into ½ inch pieces. If fresh pineapple and papaya isn’t available, use the canned variety. For the healthiest option, looked for canned fruit packed in its own juice (rather than syrup). Layer the ingredients into six glasses. Set out your glasses and layer the elements in the following order: papaya chunks, yogurt mixture, pineapple chunks, yogurt mixture, strawberry slices, yogurt mixture. Top each glass off with one tablespoon of low-fat granola. Serve immediately. Experiment with other toppings like dried coconut flakes, macadamia nuts, fresh lemon zest and sliced almonds. Putting Together Easy Tropical Breakfast Parfaits Put two tablespoons of yogurt into each glass. Set out four juice glasses and spoon two tablespoons of vanilla yogurt into the bottom of each one. Use low-fat or non-fat yogurt – whichever you prefer. Feel free to experiment with other yogurt flavors. Strawberry and coconut yogurt would both be excellent tropical-themed yogurt alternatives. Divide the mandarin orange slices between the four glasses. Open the canned mandarin slices and drain away the juice/syrup. Evenly divide the slices between the four glasses and layer them on top of the yogurt. Add a layer of cereal followed by more yogurt. Measure out 1 ½ tablespoons of the breakfast cereal and sprinkle it on top of the oranges in each glass. Spoon two more tablespoons of yogurt over the cereal layer. This recipe calls crisped rice cereal, but you can experiment with your favorite cereals and granola. Add a layer of diced pineapple. Cut the base off the pineapple, then cut away the peel. Slice the pineapple away from the core and dice them into bite-sized chunks. Layer ¼ cup of pineapple into each glass. If fresh pineapple isn’t available, use canned pineapple packed in its own juice. Add a final layer of cereal. Top it all off with 1 ½ tablespoons of breakfast cereal. Serve immediately. Try additional toppings like dried coconut flakes, macadamia nuts, sliced almonds and dried cranberries. Making Low-Carb Tropical Berry and Almond Breakfast Parfaits Combine the cream, sugar substitute and extract. Measure out these ingredients and place them in a medium-sized bowl. Beat the ingredients with a mixer on medium speed until stiff peaks form. Fold the yogurt into the mixture. Measure out the Greek yogurt and place it into the bowl with the cream mixture. Run a rubber spatula or large metal spoon around the sides of the bowl, then along the base, in one smooth motion. Fold the mixture over itself. Rotate the bowl 90 degrees and repeat. Stop once the ingredients are incorporated. Puree the raspberries and sugar substitute. Rinse one cup of raspberries and place them into a blender. Add the remaining sugar substitute on top and put the lid on. Pulse the blender until the mixture appears smooth. Layer the ingredients in the glasses. Set out four parfait glasses and alternate the ingredients in each glass in this order: whipped cream, raspberry puree, blueberries, nuts, and coconut. Make two layers of each per glass. Serve immediately. Consider additional toppings like macadamia nuts, sliced almonds, low-fat granola and dried cranberries. Finished.

Measure these ingredients out and place them into a medium-sized bowl.
Use a whisk or spoon to mix them together until well-incorporated.
Slice the fruit.
Rinse the strawberries and slice them into ½ inch pieces.
Slice the papaya lengthwise, then scoop out the seeds.
Cut the flesh of the fruit away from the skin, then cut into ½ inch pieces.
Slice the leaves and base off the pineapple, then cut the peel off.
Slice the fruit away from the core and dice into ½ inch pieces.
If fresh pineapple and papaya isn’t available, use the canned variety.
For the healthiest option, looked for canned fruit packed in its own juice (rather than syrup).
Layer the ingredients into six glasses.
Set out your glasses and layer the elements in the following order: papaya chunks, yogurt mixture, pineapple chunks, yogurt mixture, strawberry slices, yogurt mixture.
Top each glass off with one tablespoon of low-fat granola.
Serve immediately.
Experiment with other toppings like dried coconut flakes, macadamia nuts, fresh lemon zest and sliced almonds.

Set out four juice glasses and spoon two tablespoons of vanilla yogurt into the bottom of each one.
Use low-fat or non-fat yogurt – whichever you prefer.
Feel free to experiment with other yogurt flavors.
Strawberry and coconut yogurt would both be excellent tropical-themed yogurt alternatives.
Divide the mandarin orange slices between the four glasses.
Open the canned mandarin slices and drain away the juice/syrup.
Evenly divide the slices between the four glasses and layer them on top of the yogurt.
Add a layer of cereal followed by more yogurt.
Measure out 1 ½ tablespoons of the breakfast cereal and sprinkle it on top of the oranges in each glass.
Spoon two more tablespoons of yogurt over the cereal layer.
This recipe calls crisped rice cereal, but you can experiment with your favorite cereals and granola.
Add a layer of diced pineapple.
Cut the base off the pineapple, then cut away the peel.
Slice the pineapple away from the core and dice them into bite-sized chunks.
Layer ¼ cup of pineapple into each glass.
If fresh pineapple isn’t available, use canned pineapple packed in its own juice.
Add a final layer of cereal.
Top it all off with 1 ½ tablespoons of breakfast cereal.
Serve immediately.
Try additional toppings like dried coconut flakes, macadamia nuts, sliced almonds and dried cranberries.
Making Low-Carb Tropical Berry and Almond Breakfast Parfaits Combine the cream, sugar substitute and extract.
Measure out these ingredients and place them in a medium-sized bowl.
Beat the ingredients with a mixer on medium speed until stiff peaks form.
Fold the yogurt into the mixture.
Measure out the Greek yogurt and place it into the bowl with the cream mixture.
Run a rubber spatula or large metal spoon around the sides of the bowl, then along the base, in one smooth motion.
Fold the mixture over itself.
Rotate the bowl 90 degrees and repeat.
Stop once the ingredients are incorporated.
Puree the raspberries and sugar substitute.
Rinse one cup of raspberries and place them into a blender.
Add the remaining sugar substitute on top and put the lid on.
Pulse the blender until the mixture appears smooth.
Layer the ingredients in the glasses.
Set out four parfait glasses and alternate the ingredients in each glass in this order: whipped cream, raspberry puree, blueberries, nuts, and coconut.
Make two layers of each per glass.
Serve immediately.
Consider additional toppings like macadamia nuts, sliced almonds, low-fat granola and dried cranberries.
Finished.
